00051 #ifndef GRINLIZ_TYPES_INCLUDED
00052     #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1400 )
00053         #include <stdlib.h>
00054         typedef uintptr_t       UPTR;
00055     #elif defined (__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ >= 3 )
00056         #include <stdlib.h>
00057         typedef uintptr_t       UPTR;
00058     #else
00059         // Assume not 64 bit pointers. Get a new compiler.
00060         typedef unsigned UPTR;
00061     #endif
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 /*  USE_LIST and USE_BINARY_HASH change the some of details the pather algorithms. They
00065     are set optimally in my experiments, but different applications may benefit
00066     from a different combination of these #defines.
00067 */
00068 #define USE_LIST
00069 //#define USE_BINARY_HASH
00070 
00071 namespace micropather
00072 {
00073     const float FLT_BIG = FLT_MAX / 2.0f;   
00074 
00081     struct StateCost
00082     {
00083         void* state;            
00084         float cost;             
00085     };

00102     class Graph
00103     {
00104       public:
00105         virtual ~Graph() {}
00106       
00113         virtual float LeastCostEstimate( void* stateStart, void* stateEnd ) = 0;
00114 
00121         virtual void AdjacentCost( void* state, std::vector< micropather::StateCost > *adjacent ) = 0;
00122 
00130         virtual void  PrintStateInfo( void* state ) = 0;
00131     };

00134     class PathNode;
00135 
00136     struct NodeCost
00137     {
00138         PathNode* node;
00139         float cost;
00140     };

00143     class PathNode
00144     {
00145         friend class none;  // Trashy trick to get rid of compiler warning, because
00146                             // this class has a private constructor and destructor -
00147                             // it can never be "new" or created on the stack, only
00148                             // by special allocators.
00149       public:
00150         void Init(  unsigned _frame,
00151                     void* _state,
00152                     float _costFromStart, 
00153                     float _estToGoal, 
00154                     PathNode* _parent )
00155         {
00156             state = _state;
00157             costFromStart = _costFromStart;
00158             estToGoal = _estToGoal;
00159             totalCost = _costFromStart + _estToGoal;
00160             parent = _parent;
00161             frame = _frame;
00162             numAdjacent = -1;
00163             left = 0;
00164             #ifdef USE_BINARY_HASH
00165             right = 0;
00166             #endif
00167             #ifdef USE_LIST
00168             next = 0;
00169             prev = 0;
00170             #endif
00171             inOpen = 0;
00172             inClosed = 0;
00173         }
00174 
00175         void Reuse( unsigned _frame, float _costFromStart, float _estToGoal, PathNode* _parent ) 
00176         {
00177             costFromStart = _costFromStart;
00178             estToGoal = _estToGoal;
00179             parent = _parent;
00180             frame = _frame;
00181 
00182             inOpen = 0;
00183             inClosed = 0;
00184         }
00185 
00186         void *state;            // the client state
00187         float costFromStart;    // exact
00188         float estToGoal;        // estimated
00189         float totalCost;        // could be a function, but save some math.
00190         PathNode* parent;       // the parent is used to reconstruct the path
00191         unsigned frame;         // unique id for this path, so the solver can distinguish
00192                                 // correct from stale values
00193 
00194         enum {
00195             /*
00196                 @enum MAX_CACHE. If you want to optimize "down deep" this is the way
00197                 to go. MAX_CACHE determines the number of adjacent nodes cached by 
00198                 MicroPather. If your nodes generally have 8 or 3 neighbors (common cases)
00199                 changing this may increase performance, sometimes dramatically.
00200             */
00201             MAX_CACHE = 4
00202         };
00203         // If there are 4 or less adjacent states, they will be cached as *nodes*.
00204         NodeCost adjacent[ MAX_CACHE ];
00205         int numAdjacent;                    // -1  is unknown & needs to be queried
00206                                             // 0-4 adjacent is known & in 'adjacent'
00207                                             // 5+  known, but has to be queried from Graph
00208 
00209         PathNode* left;         // Binary tree, where the 'state' is what is being compared.
00210                                 // Also used as a "next" pointer for memory layout.
00211         #ifdef USE_BINARY_HASH
00212         PathNode* right;
00213         #endif
00214         #ifdef USE_LIST
00215         PathNode *next, *prev;
00216         #endif
00217 
00218         unsigned inOpen:1;
00219         unsigned inClosed:1;
00220 
00221         #ifdef USE_LIST
00222         void Unlink() {
00223             next->prev = prev;
00224             prev->next = next;
00225             next = prev = 0;
00226         }
00227         void AddBefore( PathNode* addThis ) {
00228             addThis->next = this;
00229             addThis->prev = prev;
00230             prev->next = addThis;
00231             prev = addThis;
00232         }
00233         #ifdef DEBUG
00234         void CheckList()
00235         {
00236             assert( totalCost == FLT_MAX );
00237             for( PathNode* it = next; it != this; it=it->next ) {
00238                 assert( it->prev == this || it->totalCost >= it->prev->totalCost );
00239                 assert( it->totalCost <= it->next->totalCost );
00240             }
00241         }
00242         #endif
00243         #endif
00244 
00245       private:
00246         PathNode();
00247         ~PathNode();
00248         PathNode( const PathNode& );
00249         void operator=( const PathNode& );
00250     };
00251

00258     {
00259         friend class micropather::PathNode;
00260 
00261       public:
00262         enum
00263         {
00264             SOLVED,
00265             NO_SOLUTION,
00266             START_END_SAME,
00267         };
00268 
00284         MicroPather( Graph* graph, unsigned allocate = 250 );
00285         ~MicroPather();
00286 
00296         int Solve( void* startState, void* endState, std::vector< void* >* path, float* totalCost );
00297 
00299         void Reset();
00300 
00301         /*  Deprecated. Too complex for the practical value.
00302             @warning It is very easy to "miss" a state that needs to be changed and break the pather.
00303 
00304             As described on the main page, it is possible to change the costs (but not the connections)
00305             of states without calling Reset(). Be sure that all effected states are passed to
00306             StateCostChange.
00307         */
00308         //void StateCostChange( void* state );
00309 
00314         UPTR Checksum() { return checksum; }
00315         
00316         void DumpHashTable();
00317         
00318         // Debugging function to return all states that were used
00319         // by the last "solve" 
00320         void StatesInPool( std::vector< void* >* stateVec );
00321 
00322       private:
00323         MicroPather( const MicroPather& );  // undefined and unsupported
00324         void operator=( const MicroPather ); // undefined and unsupported
00325         
00326         void GoalReached( PathNode* node, void* start, void* end, std::vector< void* > *path );
00327         void RecPathNodeWalk( PathNode* node, int* count );
00328         
00329         // Allocates and returns memory for a new, unititialized node.
00330         PathNode* AllocatePathNode();
00331 
00332         // Returns a path node that is ready to go. 
00333         // Strictly speaking, the name is somewhat misleading, as it
00334         // may be reused from the cache, but it will be ready for use regardless.
00335         PathNode* NewPathNode( void* state, float costFromStart, float estToEnd, PathNode* parent );
00336 
00337         // Finds the node for state, or returns null. 
00338         // A node that doesn't have a correct "frame" will never be found.
00339         PathNode* FindPathNode( void* state, bool findStale = false ); 
00340 
00341         NodeCost* GetNodeNeighbors( PathNode* node, std::vector< StateCost >* neighbor, std::vector< NodeCost >* neighborNode );
00342 
00343         #ifdef DEBUG
00344         void DumpStats();
00345         #endif
00346 
00347         enum {
00348             #ifdef DEBUG_PATH
00349             HASH_SIZE = 16,         // In debug mode, stress the allocators more than in release.
00350                                     // The HASH_SIZE must be a power of 2.
00351             #else
00352             HASH_SIZE = 256,
00353             #endif
00354         };
00355 
00356         unsigned Hash( void* voidval ) {
00357             UPTR val = (UPTR)voidval;
00358             return (unsigned)((HASH_SIZE-1) & ( val + (val>>8) + (val>>16) + (val>>24) ));
00359         }    
00360     
00361         const unsigned ALLOCATE;            // how big a block of pathnodes to allocate at once
00362         const unsigned BLOCKSIZE;           // how many useable pathnodes are in a block
00363 
00364         Graph* graph;
00365         PathNode* hashTable[HASH_SIZE];     // a fixed hashtable used to "jumpstart" a binary search
00366         PathNode* pathNodeMem;              // pointer to root of PathNode blocks
00367         unsigned availMem;                  // # PathNodes available in the current block
00368         unsigned pathNodeCount;             // the # of PathNodes in use
00369         unsigned frame;                     // incremented with every solve, used to determine
00370                                             // if cached data needs to be refreshed
00371         UPTR checksum;                  // the checksum of the last successful "Solve".
00372 
00373         std::vector< StateCost > neighborVec;   // really local vars to Solve, but put here to reduce memory allocation
00374         std::vector< NodeCost > neighborNodeVec; // really local vars to Solve, but put here to reduce memory allocation
00375     };
00376 
00377     inline PathNode* MicroPather::FindPathNode( void* state, bool findStale )
00378     {
00379         unsigned key = Hash( state );
00380 
00381         PathNode* root = hashTable[key];
00382         #ifdef USE_BINARY_HASH
00383         while ( root ) {
00384             if ( root->state == state ) {
00385                 if ( findStale || root->frame == frame )
00386                     return root;
00387                 else
00388                     return 0;
00389             }
00390             else if ( state > root->state ) {
00391                 root = root->right;
00392             }
00393             else {
00394                 assert( state < root->state );
00395                 root = root->left;
00396             }
00397         }
00398         #else
00399         while( root ) {
00400             if ( root->state == state ) {
00401                 if ( findStale || root->frame == frame )
00402                     return root;
00403                 else
00404                     return 0;
00405             }
00406             else {
00407                 root = root->left;
00408             }
00409         }
00410         #endif
00411         return 0;
00412     }       
00413 };  // namespace grinliz
00414 
00415 #endif
